	<h1 id="firstHeading" class="firstHeading" lang="en">2018 United States House of Representatives elections</h1>
	<div id="bodyContent" class="mw-body-content">
		<div id="siteSub" class="noprint">From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia</div>
		<div id="contentSub"></div>
		<div id="contentSub2"></div>
		
		<div id="jump-to-nav"></div>
		<a class="mw-jump-link" href="#mw-head">Jump to navigation</a>
		<a class="mw-jump-link" href="#searchInput">Jump to search</a>
		<div id="mw-content-text" lang="en" dir="ltr" class="mw-content-ltr"><div class="mw-parser-output"><div class="shortdescription nomobile noexcerpt noprint searchaux" style="display:none">House elections for the 116th U.S. Congress</div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">For related races, see <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_elections" title="2018 United States elections">2018 United States elections</a>.</div>
<p class="mw-empty-elt">
</p>

</tbody></table></td></tr><tr><td colspan="2" style="text-align:center;text-align:center;"><hr /><a href="/wiki/File:US_House_2018.svg" class="image"><img alt="US House 2018.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/48/US_House_2018.svg/320px-US_House_2018.svg.png" decoding="async" width="320" height="186" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/48/US_House_2018.svg/480px-US_House_2018.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/48/US_House_2018.svg/640px-US_House_2018.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1242" data-file-height="720" /></a><div><b>Results:</b><br /><span style="margin:0px; font-size:90%;"><span style="border:none; background-color:#92C5DE; color:#92C5DE;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</span>&#160;Democratic hold</span> <span style="margin:0px; font-size:90%;"><span style="border:none; background-color:#0671B0; color:#0671B0;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</span>&#160;Democratic gain</span><br /><span style="margin:0px; font-size:90%;"><span style="border:none; background-color:#F48882; color:#F48882;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</span>&#160;Republican hold</span> <span style="margin:0px; font-size:90%;"><span style="border:none; background-color:#CA0120; color:#CA0120;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</span>&#160;Republican gain</span><br /><span style="margin:0px; font-size:90%;"><span style="border:none; background-color:#CCCCCC; color:#CCCCCC;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</span>&#160;Result voided and sent to special election<sup id="cite_ref-Vacancy_8-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Vacancy-8">&#91;e&#93;</a></sup></span></div></td></tr><tr><td colspan="2" style="text-align:center;text-align:center;"><hr />
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="background:transparent; width:100%;">
<tbody><tr>
<td style="width:50%; text-align:left;"><b><a href="/wiki/Speaker_of_the_United_States_House_of_Representatives" title="Speaker of the United States House of Representatives">Speaker</a> before election</b><br />
<p><a href="/wiki/Paul_Ryan" title="Paul Ryan">Paul Ryan</a><br />
<a href="/wiki/Republican_Party_(US)" class="mw-redirect" title="Republican Party (US)">Republican</a>
</p>
</td>
<td style="width:50%; text-align:right;"><b>Elected <a href="/wiki/Speaker_of_the_United_States_House_of_Representatives" title="Speaker of the United States House of Representatives">Speaker</a></b> <br />
<p><a href="/wiki/Nancy_Pelosi" title="Nancy Pelosi">Nancy Pelosi</a><br />
<a href="/wiki/Democratic_Party_(US)" class="mw-redirect" title="Democratic Party (US)">Democratic</a>
</p>
</td></tr></tbody></table></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p>The <b>2018 United States House of Representatives elections</b> were held on November 6, 2018, with early voting taking place in some states in the weeks preceding that date. Voters chose representatives from all 435 <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_congressional_districts" title="List of United States congressional districts">congressional districts</a> across each of the 50 <a href="/wiki/U.S._state" title="U.S. state">U.S. states</a>. <a href="/wiki/Delegate_(United_States_Congress)" class="mw-redirect" title="Delegate (United States Congress)">Non-voting delegates</a> from the <a href="/wiki/District_of_Columbia" class="mw-redirect" title="District of Columbia">District of Columbia</a> and four of the five inhabited <a href="/wiki/Insular_area" title="Insular area">U.S. territories</a><sup id="cite_ref-9" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-9">&#91;f&#93;</a></sup> were also elected. These <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_elections" title="2018 United States elections">midterm elections</a> took place nearly halfway through the first term of <a href="/wiki/Republican_Party_(United_States)" title="Republican Party (United States)">Republican</a> President <a href="/wiki/Donald_Trump" title="Donald Trump">Donald Trump</a>. On Election Day, Republicans had held a House majority since <a href="/wiki/2010_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections" title="2010 United States House of Representatives elections">January 2011</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-10" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-10">&#91;4&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>In the 2018 elections, the <a href="/wiki/Democratic_Party_(United_States)" title="Democratic Party (United States)">Democrats</a>, led by <a href="/wiki/Nancy_Pelosi" title="Nancy Pelosi">Nancy Pelosi</a>, won control of the House. The Democrats gained a net total of 41 seats from the total number of seats they had won in the <a href="/wiki/2016_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections" title="2016 United States House of Representatives elections">2016 elections</a>. The 41-seat gain was the Democrats' largest gain of House seats since the post-Watergate <a href="/wiki/1974_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections" title="1974 United States House of Representatives elections">1974 elections</a>, when they picked up 49 seats. The Democrats also won the popular vote by a margin of 8.6%, the largest margin on record for a party that previously held a minority in the House. Turnout was the highest for a midterm election in more than a century, with over half the electorate casting ballots.
</p><p>Upon the opening of the <a href="/wiki/116th_United_States_Congress" title="116th United States Congress">116th United States Congress</a>, Pelosi was <a href="/wiki/2019_Speaker_of_the_United_States_House_of_Representatives_election" title="2019 Speaker of the United States House of Representatives election">elected</a> as <a href="/wiki/Speaker_of_the_United_States_House_of_Representatives" title="Speaker of the United States House of Representatives">Speaker of the House</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-11" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-11">&#91;5&#93;</a></sup> Incumbent Republican House Speaker <a href="/wiki/Paul_Ryan" title="Paul Ryan">Paul Ryan</a> chose not to run for another term.<sup id="cite_ref-12" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-12">&#91;6&#93;</a></sup> In November 2018, House Republicans elected <a href="/wiki/Kevin_McCarthy_(California_politician)" title="Kevin McCarthy (California politician)">Kevin McCarthy</a> as House Minority Leader.<sup id="cite_ref-13" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-13">&#91;7&#93;</a></sup>
</p>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Results_summary_and_analysis">Results summary and analysis</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" title="Edit section: Results summary and analysis">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>The <a href="/wiki/Democratic_Party_(United_States)" title="Democratic Party (United States)">Democratic Party</a> won control of the House of Representatives in the 2018 midterm elections. The Democrats gained a net total of 41 seats from the total number of seats they had won in the <a href="/wiki/2016_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections" title="2016 United States House of Representatives elections">2016 elections</a>. This was their largest gain of House seats in an election since the <a href="/wiki/1974_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections" title="1974 United States House of Representatives elections">1974 elections</a>, when the Democrats gained 49 House seats.<sup id="cite_ref-14" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-14">&#91;8&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-15" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-15">&#91;9&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-16" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-16">&#91;10&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-17" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-17">&#91;11&#93;</a></sup> Democrats won the popular vote by more than 9.7&#160;million votes or 8.6%,<sup id="cite_ref-popular_vote_18-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-popular_vote-18">&#91;12&#93;</a></sup> the largest midterm margin for any party<sup id="cite_ref-19" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-19">&#91;13&#93;</a></sup> and the largest margin on record for a minority party.<sup id="cite_ref-20" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20">&#91;14&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>According to the <a href="/wiki/Associated_Press" title="Associated Press">Associated Press'</a> statistical analysis, <a href="/wiki/Gerrymandering" title="Gerrymandering">gerrymandering</a> cost the Democrats an additional sixteen House seats from Republicans.<sup id="cite_ref-21" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-21">&#91;15&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Voter turnout in this election was 50.3%,<sup id="cite_ref-2018_voter_turnout_2-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2018_voter_turnout-2">&#91;1&#93;</a></sup> the highest turnout in a U.S. midterm election since <a href="/wiki/1914_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections" title="1914 United States House of Representatives elections">1914</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Voter_turnout_since_1789_22-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Voter_turnout_since_1789-22">&#91;16&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Note that the results summary does not include blank and over/under votes which were included in the official results or votes cast in the <a href="/wiki/2018_North_Carolina%27s_9th_congressional_district_election" title="2018 North Carolina&#39;s 9th congressional district election">voided election</a> in <a href="/wiki/North_Carolina%27s_9th_congressional_district" title="North Carolina&#39;s 9th congressional district">North Carolina's 9th congressional district</a>.
</p>
