<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Retirements">Retirements</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" title="Edit section: Retirements">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:302px;"><a href="/wiki/File:US_House_2018_Retirement.svg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3d/US_House_2018_Retirement.svg/300px-US_House_2018_Retirement.svg.png" decoding="async" width="300" height="174" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3d/US_House_2018_Retirement.svg/450px-US_House_2018_Retirement.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3d/US_House_2018_Retirement.svg/600px-US_House_2018_Retirement.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1242" data-file-height="720" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:US_House_2018_Retirement.svg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Map showing districts of incumbents who did not seek re-election — in dark blue (Democrats) and dark red (Republicans)</div></div></div>
<p>In the November general elections, fifty-four incumbents did not seek re-election, either to retire or to seek other positions.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Democrats">Democrats</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" title="Edit section: Democrats">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p>Eighteen Democrats did not seek re-election.
</p>
<ol><li><span data-sort-value="Arizona09&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Arizona%27s_9th_congressional_district" title="Arizona&#39;s 9th congressional district">Arizona&#160;9</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Kyrsten_Sinema" title="Kyrsten Sinema">Kyrsten Sinema</a> retired to <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_Senate_election_in_Arizona" title="2018 United States Senate election in Arizona">run successfully for U.S. Senator</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Colorado02&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Colorado%27s_2nd_congressional_district" title="Colorado&#39;s 2nd congressional district">Colorado&#160;2</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Jared_Polis" title="Jared Polis">Jared Polis</a> retired to <a href="/wiki/2018_Colorado_gubernatorial_election" title="2018 Colorado gubernatorial election">run successfully for Governor of Colorado</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Connecticut05&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Connecticut%27s_5th_congressional_district" title="Connecticut&#39;s 5th congressional district">Connecticut&#160;5</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Elizabeth_Esty" title="Elizabeth Esty">Elizabeth Esty</a> retired after involvement in sexual harassment allegations against an employee.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-25" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-25">&#91;19&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Hawaii01&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Hawaii%27s_1st_congressional_district" title="Hawaii&#39;s 1st congressional district">Hawaii&#160;1</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Colleen_Hanabusa" title="Colleen Hanabusa">Colleen Hanabusa</a> retired to <a href="/wiki/2018_Hawaii_gubernatorial_election" title="2018 Hawaii gubernatorial election">run for Governor of Hawaii</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Illinois04&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Illinois%27s_4th_congressional_district" title="Illinois&#39;s 4th congressional district">Illinois&#160;4</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Luis_Guti%C3%A9rrez" title="Luis Gutiérrez">Luis Gutiérrez</a> retired.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Maryland06&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Maryland%27s_6th_congressional_district" title="Maryland&#39;s 6th congressional district">Maryland&#160;6</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/John_Delaney_(Maryland_politician)" title="John Delaney (Maryland politician)">John Delaney</a> retired to <a href="/wiki/2020_United_States_presidential_election" title="2020 United States presidential election">run for U.S. President</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Massachusetts03&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Massachusetts%27s_3rd_congressional_district" title="Massachusetts&#39;s 3rd congressional district">Massachusetts&#160;3</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Niki_Tsongas" title="Niki Tsongas">Niki Tsongas</a> retired.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Michigan09&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Michigan%27s_9th_congressional_district" title="Michigan&#39;s 9th congressional district">Michigan&#160;9</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Sander_Levin" title="Sander Levin">Sander Levin</a> retired.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Minnesota01&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Minnesota%27s_1st_congressional_district" title="Minnesota&#39;s 1st congressional district">Minnesota&#160;1</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Tim_Walz" title="Tim Walz">Tim Walz</a> retired to <a href="/wiki/2018_Minnesota_gubernatorial_election" title="2018 Minnesota gubernatorial election">run successfully for Governor of Minnesota</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-8" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Minnesota05&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Minnesota%27s_5th_congressional_district" title="Minnesota&#39;s 5th congressional district">Minnesota&#160;5</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Keith_Ellison" title="Keith Ellison">Keith Ellison</a> retired to <a href="/wiki/2018_Minnesota_Attorney_General_election" title="2018 Minnesota Attorney General election">run successfully for Minnesota Attorney General</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-26" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-26">&#91;20&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Minnesota08&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Minnesota%27s_8th_congressional_district" title="Minnesota&#39;s 8th congressional district">Minnesota&#160;8</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Rick_Nolan" title="Rick Nolan">Rick Nolan</a> retired.<sup id="cite_ref-27" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-27">&#91;21&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-28" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-28">&#91;22&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Nevada03&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Nevada%27s_3rd_congressional_district" title="Nevada&#39;s 3rd congressional district">Nevada&#160;3</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Jacky_Rosen" title="Jacky Rosen">Jacky Rosen</a> retired to <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_Senate_election_in_Nevada" title="2018 United States Senate election in Nevada">run successfully for U.S. Senator</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-9" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Nevada04&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Nevada%27s_4th_congressional_district" title="Nevada&#39;s 4th congressional district">Nevada&#160;4</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Ruben_Kihuen" title="Ruben Kihuen">Rubén Kihuen</a> retired due to sexual harassment allegations.<sup id="cite_ref-29" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-29">&#91;23&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="New Hampshire01&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/New_Hampshire%27s_1st_congressional_district" title="New Hampshire&#39;s 1st congressional district">New Hampshire&#160;1</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Carol_Shea-Porter" title="Carol Shea-Porter">Carol Shea-Porter</a> retired.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-10" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="New Mexico01&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/New_Mexico%27s_1st_congressional_district" title="New Mexico&#39;s 1st congressional district">New Mexico&#160;1</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Michelle_Lujan_Grisham" title="Michelle Lujan Grisham">Michelle Lujan Grisham</a> retired to <a href="/wiki/2018_New_Mexico_gubernatorial_election" title="2018 New Mexico gubernatorial election">run successfully for Governor of New Mexico</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-11" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Pennsylvania02&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Pennsylvania%27s_2nd_congressional_district" title="Pennsylvania&#39;s 2nd congressional district">Pennsylvania&#160;2</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Bob_Brady" title="Bob Brady">Bob Brady</a>: retired after being redistricted from the 1st district.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-12" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Texas16&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Texas%27s_16th_congressional_district" title="Texas&#39;s 16th congressional district">Texas&#160;16</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Beto_O%27Rourke" title="Beto O&#39;Rourke">Beto O'Rourke</a> retired to <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_Senate_election_in_Texas" title="2018 United States Senate election in Texas">run for U.S. Senator</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-13" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Texas29&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Texas%27s_29th_congressional_district" title="Texas&#39;s 29th congressional district">Texas&#160;29</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Gene_Green" title="Gene Green">Gene Green</a> retired.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-14" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li></ol>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Republicans">Republicans</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" title="Edit section: Republicans">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p>Thirty-seven Republicans did not seek re-election.
</p>
<ol><li><span data-sort-value="Arizona02&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Arizona%27s_2nd_congressional_district" title="Arizona&#39;s 2nd congressional district">Arizona&#160;2</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Martha_McSally" title="Martha McSally">Martha McSally</a> retired to <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_Senate_election_in_Arizona" title="2018 United States Senate election in Arizona">run for U.S. Senator</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-15" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="California39&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/California%27s_39th_congressional_district" title="California&#39;s 39th congressional district">California&#160;39</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Ed_Royce" title="Ed Royce">Ed Royce</a> retired.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-16" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="California49&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/California%27s_49th_congressional_district" title="California&#39;s 49th congressional district">California&#160;49</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Darrell_Issa" title="Darrell Issa">Darrell Issa</a> retired, appointed by President <a href="/wiki/Donald_Trump" title="Donald Trump">Donald Trump</a> to be the Director of the United States Trade and Development Agency.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-17" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Florida06&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Florida%27s_6th_congressional_district" title="Florida&#39;s 6th congressional district">Florida&#160;6</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Ron_DeSantis" title="Ron DeSantis">Ron DeSantis</a> resigned to <a href="/wiki/2018_Florida_gubernatorial_election" title="2018 Florida gubernatorial election">run for Governor of Florida</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Florida15&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Florida%27s_15th_congressional_district" title="Florida&#39;s 15th congressional district">Florida&#160;15</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Dennis_Ross_(politician)" title="Dennis Ross (politician)">Dennis Ross</a> retired.<sup id="cite_ref-30" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-30">&#91;24&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Florida17&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Florida%27s_17th_congressional_district" title="Florida&#39;s 17th congressional district">Florida&#160;17</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Tom_Rooney_(Florida_politician)" title="Tom Rooney (Florida politician)">Tom Rooney</a> retired.<sup id="cite_ref-31" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-31">&#91;25&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-32" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-32">&#91;26&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Florida27&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Florida%27s_27th_congressional_district" title="Florida&#39;s 27th congressional district">Florida&#160;27</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Ileana_Ros-Lehtinen" title="Ileana Ros-Lehtinen">Ileana Ros-Lehtinen</a> retired.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-18" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Idaho01&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Idaho%27s_1st_congressional_district" title="Idaho&#39;s 1st congressional district">Idaho&#160;1</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Ra%C3%BAl_Labrador" title="Raúl Labrador">Raúl Labrador</a> retired to <a href="/wiki/2018_Idaho_gubernatorial_election" title="2018 Idaho gubernatorial election">run for Governor of Idaho</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-19" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Indiana04&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Indiana%27s_4th_congressional_district" title="Indiana&#39;s 4th congressional district">Indiana&#160;4</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Todd_Rokita" title="Todd Rokita">Todd Rokita</a> retired to <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_Senate_election_in_Indiana" title="2018 United States Senate election in Indiana">run for U.S. Senator</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-20" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Indiana06&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Indiana%27s_6th_congressional_district" title="Indiana&#39;s 6th congressional district">Indiana&#160;6</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Luke_Messer" title="Luke Messer">Luke Messer</a> retired to <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_Senate_election_in_Indiana" title="2018 United States Senate election in Indiana">run for U.S. Senator</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-21" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Kansas02&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Kansas%27s_2nd_congressional_district" title="Kansas&#39;s 2nd congressional district">Kansas&#160;2</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Lynn_Jenkins" title="Lynn Jenkins">Lynn Jenkins</a> retired.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-22" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Michigan11&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Michigan%27s_11th_congressional_district" title="Michigan&#39;s 11th congressional district">Michigan&#160;11</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Dave_Trott_(politician)" title="Dave Trott (politician)">Dave Trott</a> retired.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-23" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Mississippi03&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Mississippi%27s_3rd_congressional_district" title="Mississippi&#39;s 3rd congressional district">Mississippi&#160;3</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Gregg_Harper" title="Gregg Harper">Gregg Harper</a> retired.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-24" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="New Jersey02&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/New_Jersey%27s_2nd_congressional_district" title="New Jersey&#39;s 2nd congressional district">New Jersey&#160;2</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Frank_LoBiondo" title="Frank LoBiondo">Frank LoBiondo</a> retired "due to the increased political polarization of Congress."<sup id="cite_ref-33" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-33">&#91;27&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="New Jersey11&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/New_Jersey%27s_11th_congressional_district" title="New Jersey&#39;s 11th congressional district">New Jersey&#160;11</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Rodney_Frelinghuysen" title="Rodney Frelinghuysen">Rodney Frelinghuysen</a> retired.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-25" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="New Mexico02&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/New_Mexico%27s_2nd_congressional_district" title="New Mexico&#39;s 2nd congressional district">New Mexico&#160;2</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Steve_Pearce_(politician)" title="Steve Pearce (politician)">Steve Pearce</a> retired to <a href="/wiki/2018_New_Mexico_gubernatorial_election" title="2018 New Mexico gubernatorial election">run for Governor of New Mexico</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-26" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="North DakotaAL&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/North_Dakota%27s_at-large_congressional_district" title="North Dakota&#39;s at-large congressional district">North Dakota&#160;at-large</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Kevin_Cramer" title="Kevin Cramer">Kevin Cramer</a> retired to <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_Senate_election_in_North_Dakota" title="2018 United States Senate election in North Dakota">run for U.S. Senator</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-34" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-34">&#91;28&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Ohio16&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Ohio%27s_16th_congressional_district" title="Ohio&#39;s 16th congressional district">Ohio&#160;16</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Jim_Renacci" title="Jim Renacci">Jim Renacci</a> retired to <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_Senate_election_in_Ohio" title="2018 United States Senate election in Ohio">run for U.S. Senator</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-27" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Oklahoma01&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Oklahoma%27s_1st_congressional_district" title="Oklahoma&#39;s 1st congressional district">Oklahoma&#160;1</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Jim_Bridenstine" title="Jim Bridenstine">Jim Bridenstine</a> announced his retirement November 10, 2017. He resigned April 23, 2018, after being confirmed as <a href="/wiki/List_of_Administrators_and_Deputy_Administrators_of_NASA" class="mw-redirect" title="List of Administrators and Deputy Administrators of NASA">Administrator of NASA</a>; his replacement was seated November 6, 2018.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Pennsylvania06&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Pennsylvania%27s_6th_congressional_district" title="Pennsylvania&#39;s 6th congressional district">Pennsylvania&#160;6</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Ryan_Costello" title="Ryan Costello">Ryan Costello</a> retired due to "family, the political environment and redistricting."<sup id="cite_ref-35" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-35">&#91;29&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Pennsylvania09&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Pennsylvania%27s_9th_congressional_district" title="Pennsylvania&#39;s 9th congressional district">Pennsylvania&#160;9</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Lou_Barletta" title="Lou Barletta">Lou Barletta</a>, redistricted from the 11th district, retired to <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_Senate_election_in_Pennsylvania" title="2018 United States Senate election in Pennsylvania">run for U.S. Senator</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-28" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Pennsylvania13&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Pennsylvania%27s_13th_congressional_district" title="Pennsylvania&#39;s 13th congressional district">Pennsylvania&#160;13</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Bill_Shuster" title="Bill Shuster">Bill Shuster</a> retired when redistricted from the 9th district.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-29" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="South Carolina04&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/South_Carolina%27s_4th_congressional_district" title="South Carolina&#39;s 4th congressional district">South Carolina&#160;4</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Trey_Gowdy" title="Trey Gowdy">Trey Gowdy</a> retired to "return to the justice system."<sup id="cite_ref-36" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-36">&#91;30&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="South DakotaAL&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/South_Dakota%27s_at-large_congressional_district" title="South Dakota&#39;s at-large congressional district">South Dakota&#160;at-large</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Kristi_Noem" title="Kristi Noem">Kristi Noem</a> retired to <a href="/wiki/2018_South_Dakota_gubernatorial_election" title="2018 South Dakota gubernatorial election">run for Governor of South Dakota</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-30" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Tennessee02&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Tennessee%27s_2nd_congressional_district" title="Tennessee&#39;s 2nd congressional district">Tennessee&#160;2</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Jimmy_Duncan_(politician)" title="Jimmy Duncan (politician)">Jimmy Duncan</a> retired.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-31" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Tennessee06&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Tennessee%27s_6th_congressional_district" title="Tennessee&#39;s 6th congressional district">Tennessee&#160;6</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Diane_Black" title="Diane Black">Diane Black</a> retired to <a href="/wiki/2018_Tennessee_gubernatorial_election" title="2018 Tennessee gubernatorial election">run for Governor of Tennessee</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-32" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Tennessee07&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Tennessee%27s_7th_congressional_district" title="Tennessee&#39;s 7th congressional district">Tennessee&#160;7</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Marsha_Blackburn" title="Marsha Blackburn">Marsha Blackburn</a> retired to <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_Senate_election_in_Tennessee" title="2018 United States Senate election in Tennessee">run for U.S. Senator</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-37" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-37">&#91;31&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Texas02&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Texas%27s_2nd_congressional_district" title="Texas&#39;s 2nd congressional district">Texas&#160;2</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Ted_Poe" title="Ted Poe">Ted Poe</a> retired.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-33" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Texas03&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Texas%27s_3rd_congressional_district" title="Texas&#39;s 3rd congressional district">Texas&#160;3</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Sam_Johnson" title="Sam Johnson">Sam Johnson</a> retired.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-34" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Texas05&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Texas%27s_5th_congressional_district" title="Texas&#39;s 5th congressional district">Texas&#160;5</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Jeb_Hensarling" title="Jeb Hensarling">Jeb Hensarling</a> retired.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-35" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Texas06&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Texas%27s_6th_congressional_district" title="Texas&#39;s 6th congressional district">Texas&#160;6</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Joe_Barton" title="Joe Barton">Joe Barton</a> retired.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-36" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Texas21&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Texas%27s_21st_congressional_district" title="Texas&#39;s 21st congressional district">Texas&#160;21</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Lamar_Smith" title="Lamar Smith">Lamar Smith</a> retired.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-37" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Virginia05&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Virginia%27s_5th_congressional_district" title="Virginia&#39;s 5th congressional district">Virginia&#160;5</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Tom_Garrett_(Virginia_politician)" title="Tom Garrett (Virginia politician)">Tom Garrett</a> retired due to alcoholism.<sup id="cite_ref-38" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-38">&#91;32&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Virginia06&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Virginia%27s_6th_congressional_district" title="Virginia&#39;s 6th congressional district">Virginia&#160;6</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Bob_Goodlatte" title="Bob Goodlatte">Bob Goodlatte</a> retired.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-38" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Washington08&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Washington%27s_8th_congressional_district" title="Washington&#39;s 8th congressional district">Washington&#160;8</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Dave_Reichert" title="Dave Reichert">Dave Reichert</a> retired.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-39" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="West Virginia03&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/West_Virginia%27s_3rd_congressional_district" title="West Virginia&#39;s 3rd congressional district">West Virginia&#160;3</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Evan_Jenkins_(politician)" title="Evan Jenkins (politician)">Evan Jenkins</a> retired to <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_Senate_election_in_West_Virginia" title="2018 United States Senate election in West Virginia">run for U.S. Senator</a> and then resigned to become State Supreme Court Justice.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Wisconsin01&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Wisconsin%27s_1st_congressional_district" title="Wisconsin&#39;s 1st congressional district">Wisconsin&#160;1</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Paul_Ryan" title="Paul Ryan">Paul Ryan</a> retired.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-40" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li></ol>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Resignations_and_death">Resignations and death</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5" title="Edit section: Resignations and death">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>Four seats opened early due to resignations or death and were not filled until the November elections.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Democrats_2">Democrats</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6" title="Edit section: Democrats">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p>One Democrat resigned and one died.
</p>
<ol><li><span data-sort-value="Michigan13&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Michigan%27s_13th_congressional_district" title="Michigan&#39;s 13th congressional district">Michigan&#160;13</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/John_Conyers" title="John Conyers">John Conyers</a> resigned and <a href="/wiki/Brenda_Jones_(politician)" title="Brenda Jones (politician)">Brenda Jones</a> won only the special election to complete Conyers's term.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="New York25&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/New_York%27s_25th_congressional_district" title="New York&#39;s 25th congressional district">New York&#160;25</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Louise_Slaughter" title="Louise Slaughter">Louise Slaughter</a> died.</li></ol>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Republicans_2">Republicans</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7" title="Edit section: Republicans">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p>Two Republicans resigned.
</p>
<ol><li><span data-sort-value="Pennsylvania05&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Pennsylvania%27s_5th_congressional_district" title="Pennsylvania&#39;s 5th congressional district">Pennsylvania&#160;5</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Pat_Meehan" title="Pat Meehan">Pat Meehan</a> resigned when redistricted from the 7th district.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Pennsylvania07&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Pennsylvania%27s_7th_congressional_district" title="Pennsylvania&#39;s 7th congressional district">Pennsylvania&#160;7</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Charlie_Dent" title="Charlie Dent">Charlie Dent</a> resigned when redistricted from the 15th district.</li></ol>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Incumbents_defeated">Incumbents defeated</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8" title="Edit section: Incumbents defeated">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:302px;"><a href="/wiki/File:116th_US_Congress_House.svg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/116th_US_Congress_House.svg/300px-116th_US_Congress_House.svg.png" decoding="async" width="300" height="186" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/116th_US_Congress_House.svg/450px-116th_US_Congress_House.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/116th_US_Congress_House.svg/600px-116th_US_Congress_House.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="512" data-file-height="317" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:116th_US_Congress_House.svg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>House seats by party holding plurality in state</div></div></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:302px;"><a href="/wiki/File:2018_Changes_to_U.S._House_Delegations.svg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/56/2018_Changes_to_U.S._House_Delegations.svg/300px-2018_Changes_to_U.S._House_Delegations.svg.png" decoding="async" width="300" height="186" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/56/2018_Changes_to_U.S._House_Delegations.svg/450px-2018_Changes_to_U.S._House_Delegations.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/56/2018_Changes_to_U.S._House_Delegations.svg/600px-2018_Changes_to_U.S._House_Delegations.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="512" data-file-height="317" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:2018_Changes_to_U.S._House_Delegations.svg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div><b>Net changes to U.S. House seats after the 2018 elections</b><br /><span style="margin:0px; font-size:90%;"><span style="border:none; background-color:#55DDFF; color:#55DDFF;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</span>&#160;+1 Dem House Seat</span> <span style="margin:0px; font-size:90%;"><span style="border:none; background-color:#2A7FFF; color:#2A7FFF;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</span>&#160;+2 Dem House Seats</span><br /><span style="margin:0px; font-size:90%;"><span style="border:none; background-color:#0000FF; color:#0000FF;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</span>&#160;+3-4 Dem House Seats</span> <span style="margin:0px; font-size:90%;"><span style="border:none; background-color:#003380; color:#003380;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</span>&#160;+7 Dem House Seats</span><br /><span style="margin:0px; font-size:90%;"><span style="border:none; background-color:#B3B3B3; color:#B3B3B3;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</span>&#160;Both parties won 2 seats and lost 2 seats, no net change</span></div></div></div>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="In_primary_elections">In primary elections</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9" title="Edit section: In primary elections">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Democrats_3">Democrats</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10" title="Edit section: Democrats">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<p>Three Democrats (including one non-voting delegate) lost renomination.
</p>
<ol><li><span data-sort-value="GuamAL&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Guam%27s_at-large_congressional_district" title="Guam&#39;s at-large congressional district">Guam&#160;at-large</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Non-voting_members_of_the_United_States_House_of_Representatives" title="Non-voting members of the United States House of Representatives">Delegate</a> <a href="/wiki/Madeleine_Bordallo" title="Madeleine Bordallo">Madeleine Bordallo</a> lost renomination to <a href="/wiki/Michael_San_Nicolas" title="Michael San Nicolas">Michael San Nicolas</a>, who then won the general election.<sup id="cite_ref-pitimes_39-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-pitimes-39">&#91;33&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-rcguam_40-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-rcguam-40">&#91;34&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Massachusetts07&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Massachusetts%27s_7th_congressional_district" title="Massachusetts&#39;s 7th congressional district">Massachusetts&#160;7</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Mike_Capuano" title="Mike Capuano">Mike Capuano</a> lost renomination to <a href="/wiki/Ayanna_Pressley" title="Ayanna Pressley">Ayanna Pressley</a>, who then won the general election.<sup id="cite_ref-auto3_41-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-auto3-41">&#91;35&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="New York14&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/New_York%27s_14th_congressional_district" title="New York&#39;s 14th congressional district">New York&#160;14</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Joe_Crowley" title="Joe Crowley">Joe Crowley</a> lost renomination to <a href="/wiki/Alexandria_Ocasio-Cortez" title="Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez">Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez</a>, who then won the <a href="/wiki/2018_New_York%27s_14th_congressional_district_election" title="2018 New York&#39;s 14th congressional district election">general election</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-auto3_41-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-auto3-41">&#91;35&#93;</a></sup></li></ol>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Republicans_3">Republicans</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11" title="Edit section: Republicans">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<p>Two Republicans lost renomination.<sup id="cite_ref-auto3_41-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-auto3-41">&#91;35&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<ol><li><span data-sort-value="North Carolina09&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/North_Carolina%27s_9th_congressional_district" title="North Carolina&#39;s 9th congressional district">North Carolina&#160;9</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Robert_Pittenger" title="Robert Pittenger">Robert Pittenger</a> lost renomination to <a href="/wiki/Mark_Harris_(North_Carolina_politician)" title="Mark Harris (North Carolina politician)">Mark Harris</a>. A new election was ordered due to electoral fraud conducted by associates of Republican Harris's campaign.<sup id="cite_ref-NC9_4-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-NC9-4">&#91;b&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="South Carolina01&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/South_Carolina%27s_1st_congressional_district" title="South Carolina&#39;s 1st congressional district">South Carolina&#160;1</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Mark_Sanford" title="Mark Sanford">Mark Sanford</a> lost renomination to <a href="/wiki/Katie_Arrington" title="Katie Arrington">Katie Arrington</a>, who then lost the general election to <a href="/wiki/Joe_Cunningham_(American_politician)" title="Joe Cunningham (American politician)">Joe Cunningham</a> (D).</li></ol>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="In_the_general_election">In the general election</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=12" title="Edit section: In the general election">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Democrats_4">Democrats</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=13" title="Edit section: Democrats">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<p>No Democrats lost re-election to Republicans.<sup id="cite_ref-auto1_42-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-auto1-42">&#91;36&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Republicans_4">Republicans</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=14" title="Edit section: Republicans">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<p>Thirty Republicans lost re-election to Democrats.<sup id="cite_ref-auto1_42-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-auto1-42">&#91;36&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<ol><li><span data-sort-value="California10&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/California%27s_10th_congressional_district" title="California&#39;s 10th congressional district">California&#160;10</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Jeff_Denham" title="Jeff Denham">Jeff Denham</a> (first elected in 2010) lost to <a href="/wiki/Josh_Harder" title="Josh Harder">Josh Harder</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="California21&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/California%27s_21st_congressional_district" title="California&#39;s 21st congressional district">California&#160;21</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/David_Valadao" title="David Valadao">David Valadao</a> (first elected in 2012) lost to <a href="/wiki/TJ_Cox" title="TJ Cox">TJ Cox</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="California25&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/California%27s_25th_congressional_district" title="California&#39;s 25th congressional district">California&#160;25</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Steve_Knight_(politician)" title="Steve Knight (politician)">Steve Knight</a> (first elected in 2014) lost to <a href="/wiki/Katie_Hill_(politician)" title="Katie Hill (politician)">Katie Hill</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="California45&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/California%27s_45th_congressional_district" title="California&#39;s 45th congressional district">California&#160;45</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Mimi_Walters" title="Mimi Walters">Mimi Walters</a> (first elected in 2014) lost to <a href="/wiki/Katie_Porter" title="Katie Porter">Katie Porter</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="California48&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/California%27s_48th_congressional_district" title="California&#39;s 48th congressional district">California&#160;48</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Dana_Rohrabacher" title="Dana Rohrabacher">Dana Rohrabacher</a> (first elected in 1988) lost to <a href="/wiki/Harley_Rouda" title="Harley Rouda">Harley Rouda</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Colorado06&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Colorado%27s_6th_congressional_district" title="Colorado&#39;s 6th congressional district">Colorado&#160;6</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Mike_Coffman" title="Mike Coffman">Mike Coffman</a> (first elected in 2008) lost to <a href="/wiki/Jason_Crow" title="Jason Crow">Jason Crow</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Florida26&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Florida%27s_26th_congressional_district" title="Florida&#39;s 26th congressional district">Florida&#160;26</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Carlos_Curbelo" title="Carlos Curbelo">Carlos Curbelo</a> (first elected in 2014) lost to <a href="/wiki/Debbie_Mucarsel-Powell" title="Debbie Mucarsel-Powell">Debbie Mucarsel-Powell</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Georgia06&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Georgia%27s_6th_congressional_district" title="Georgia&#39;s 6th congressional district">Georgia&#160;6</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Karen_Handel" title="Karen Handel">Karen Handel</a> (first elected in 2017) lost to <a href="/wiki/Lucy_McBath" title="Lucy McBath">Lucy McBath</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Illinois06&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Illinois%27s_6th_congressional_district" title="Illinois&#39;s 6th congressional district">Illinois&#160;6</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Peter_Roskam" title="Peter Roskam">Peter Roskam</a> (first elected in 2006) lost to <a href="/wiki/Sean_Casten" title="Sean Casten">Sean Casten</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Illinois14&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Illinois%27s_14th_congressional_district" title="Illinois&#39;s 14th congressional district">Illinois&#160;14</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Randy_Hultgren" title="Randy Hultgren">Randy Hultgren</a> (first elected in 2010) lost to <a href="/wiki/Lauren_Underwood" title="Lauren Underwood">Lauren Underwood</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Iowa01&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Iowa%27s_1st_congressional_district" title="Iowa&#39;s 1st congressional district">Iowa&#160;1</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Rod_Blum" title="Rod Blum">Rod Blum</a> (first elected in 2014) lost to <a href="/wiki/Abby_Finkenauer" title="Abby Finkenauer">Abby Finkenauer</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Iowa03&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Iowa%27s_3rd_congressional_district" title="Iowa&#39;s 3rd congressional district">Iowa&#160;3</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/David_Young_(Iowa_politician)" title="David Young (Iowa politician)">David Young</a> (first elected in 2014) lost to <a href="/wiki/Cindy_Axne" title="Cindy Axne">Cindy Axne</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Kansas03&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Kansas%27s_3rd_congressional_district" title="Kansas&#39;s 3rd congressional district">Kansas&#160;3</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Kevin_Yoder" title="Kevin Yoder">Kevin Yoder</a> (first elected in 2010) lost to <a href="/wiki/Sharice_Davids" title="Sharice Davids">Sharice Davids</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Maine02&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Maine%27s_2nd_congressional_district" title="Maine&#39;s 2nd congressional district">Maine&#160;2</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Bruce_Poliquin" title="Bruce Poliquin">Bruce Poliquin</a> (first elected in 2014) lost to <a href="/wiki/Jared_Golden" title="Jared Golden">Jared Golden</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Michigan08&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Michigan%27s_8th_congressional_district" title="Michigan&#39;s 8th congressional district">Michigan&#160;8</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Mike_Bishop_(politician)" title="Mike Bishop (politician)">Mike Bishop</a> (first elected in 2014) lost to <a href="/wiki/Elissa_Slotkin" title="Elissa Slotkin">Elissa Slotkin</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Minnesota02&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Minnesota%27s_2nd_congressional_district" title="Minnesota&#39;s 2nd congressional district">Minnesota&#160;2</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Jason_Lewis_(Minnesota_politician)" title="Jason Lewis (Minnesota politician)">Jason Lewis</a> (first elected in 2016) lost to <a href="/wiki/Angie_Craig" title="Angie Craig">Angie Craig</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Minnesota03&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Minnesota%27s_3rd_congressional_district" title="Minnesota&#39;s 3rd congressional district">Minnesota&#160;3</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Erik_Paulsen" title="Erik Paulsen">Erik Paulsen</a> (first elected in 2008) lost to <a href="/wiki/Dean_Phillips" title="Dean Phillips">Dean Phillips</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="New Jersey03&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/New_Jersey%27s_3rd_congressional_district" title="New Jersey&#39;s 3rd congressional district">New Jersey&#160;3</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Tom_MacArthur" title="Tom MacArthur">Tom MacArthur</a> (first elected in 2014) lost to <a href="/wiki/Andy_Kim_(politician)" title="Andy Kim (politician)">Andy Kim</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="New Jersey07&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/New_Jersey%27s_7th_congressional_district" title="New Jersey&#39;s 7th congressional district">New Jersey&#160;7</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Leonard_Lance" title="Leonard Lance">Leonard Lance</a> (first elected in 2008) lost to <a href="/wiki/Tom_Malinowski" title="Tom Malinowski">Tom Malinowski</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="New York11&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/New_York%27s_11th_congressional_district" title="New York&#39;s 11th congressional district">New York&#160;11</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Dan_Donovan_(politician)" title="Dan Donovan (politician)">Dan Donovan</a> (first elected in 2015) lost to <a href="/wiki/Max_Rose_(politician)" class="mw-redirect" title="Max Rose (politician)">Max Rose</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="New York19&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/New_York%27s_19th_congressional_district" title="New York&#39;s 19th congressional district">New York&#160;19</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/John_Faso" title="John Faso">John Faso</a> (first elected in 2016) lost to <a href="/wiki/Antonio_Delgado_(politician)" title="Antonio Delgado (politician)">Antonio Delgado</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="New York22&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/New_York%27s_22nd_congressional_district" title="New York&#39;s 22nd congressional district">New York&#160;22</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Claudia_Tenney" title="Claudia Tenney">Claudia Tenney</a> (first elected in 2016) lost to <a href="/wiki/Anthony_Brindisi" title="Anthony Brindisi">Anthony Brindisi</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-43" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-43">&#91;37&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Oklahoma05&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Oklahoma%27s_5th_congressional_district" title="Oklahoma&#39;s 5th congressional district">Oklahoma&#160;5</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Steve_Russell_(politician)" title="Steve Russell (politician)">Steve Russell</a> (first elected in 2014) lost to <a href="/wiki/Kendra_Horn" title="Kendra Horn">Kendra Horn</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Pennsylvania17&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Pennsylvania%27s_17th_congressional_district" title="Pennsylvania&#39;s 17th congressional district">Pennsylvania&#160;17</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Keith_Rothfus" title="Keith Rothfus">Keith Rothfus</a> (first elected in 2012) lost a redistricting race to <a href="/wiki/Conor_Lamb" title="Conor Lamb">Conor Lamb</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Texas07&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Texas%27s_7th_congressional_district" title="Texas&#39;s 7th congressional district">Texas&#160;7</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/John_Culberson" title="John Culberson">John Culberson</a> (first elected in 2000) lost to <a href="/wiki/Lizzie_Fletcher" title="Lizzie Fletcher">Lizzie Fletcher</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Texas32&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Texas%27s_32nd_congressional_district" title="Texas&#39;s 32nd congressional district">Texas&#160;32</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Pete_Sessions" title="Pete Sessions">Pete Sessions</a> (first elected in 1996) lost to <a href="/wiki/Colin_Allred" title="Colin Allred">Colin Allred</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Utah04&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Utah%27s_4th_congressional_district" title="Utah&#39;s 4th congressional district">Utah&#160;4</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Mia_Love" title="Mia Love">Mia Love</a> (first elected in 2014) lost to <a href="/wiki/Ben_McAdams" title="Ben McAdams">Ben McAdams</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Virginia02&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Virginia%27s_2nd_congressional_district" title="Virginia&#39;s 2nd congressional district">Virginia&#160;2</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Scott_Taylor_(politician)" title="Scott Taylor (politician)">Scott Taylor</a> (first elected in 2016) lost to <a href="/wiki/Elaine_Luria" title="Elaine Luria">Elaine Luria</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Virginia07&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Virginia%27s_7th_congressional_district" title="Virginia&#39;s 7th congressional district">Virginia&#160;7</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Dave_Brat" title="Dave Brat">Dave Brat</a> (first elected in 2014) lost to <a href="/wiki/Abigail_Spanberger" title="Abigail Spanberger">Abigail Spanberger</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Virginia10&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Virginia%27s_10th_congressional_district" title="Virginia&#39;s 10th congressional district">Virginia&#160;10</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Barbara_Comstock" title="Barbara Comstock">Barbara Comstock</a> (first elected in 2014) lost to <a href="/wiki/Jennifer_Wexton" title="Jennifer Wexton">Jennifer Wexton</a>.</li></ol>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Open_seats_that_changed_parties">Open seats that changed parties</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=15" title="Edit section: Open seats that changed parties">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Democratic_seats_won_by_Republicans">Democratic seats won by Republicans</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=16" title="Edit section: Democratic seats won by Republicans">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p>Three Democratic seats were won by Republicans.
</p>
<ol><li><span data-sort-value="Minnesota01&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Minnesota%27s_1st_congressional_district" title="Minnesota&#39;s 1st congressional district">Minnesota&#160;1</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Jim_Hagedorn" title="Jim Hagedorn">Jim Hagedorn</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-44" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-44">&#91;38&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Minnesota08&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Minnesota%27s_8th_congressional_district" title="Minnesota&#39;s 8th congressional district">Minnesota&#160;8</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Pete_Stauber" title="Pete Stauber">Pete Stauber</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-auto2_45-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-auto2-45">&#91;39&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Pennsylvania14&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Pennsylvania%27s_14th_congressional_district" title="Pennsylvania&#39;s 14th congressional district">Pennsylvania&#160;14</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Conor_Lamb" title="Conor Lamb">Conor Lamb</a> instead ran in the 17th district. Won by <a href="/wiki/Guy_Reschenthaler" title="Guy Reschenthaler">Guy Reschenthaler</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-auto2_45-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-auto2-45">&#91;39&#93;</a></sup></li></ol>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Republican_seats_won_by_Democrats">Republican seats won by Democrats</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=17" title="Edit section: Republican seats won by Democrats">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p>Thirteen Republican seats were won by Democrats.
</p>
<ol><li><span data-sort-value="Arizona02&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Arizona%27s_2nd_congressional_district" title="Arizona&#39;s 2nd congressional district">Arizona&#160;2</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Ann_Kirkpatrick" title="Ann Kirkpatrick">Ann Kirkpatrick</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="California39&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/California%27s_39th_congressional_district" title="California&#39;s 39th congressional district">California&#160;39</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Gil_Cisneros" title="Gil Cisneros">Gil Cisneros</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="California49&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/California%27s_49th_congressional_district" title="California&#39;s 49th congressional district">California&#160;49</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Mike_Levin" title="Mike Levin">Mike Levin</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Florida27&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Florida%27s_27th_congressional_district" title="Florida&#39;s 27th congressional district">Florida&#160;27</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Donna_Shalala" title="Donna Shalala">Donna Shalala</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Michigan11&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Michigan%27s_11th_congressional_district" title="Michigan&#39;s 11th congressional district">Michigan&#160;11</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Haley_Stevens" title="Haley Stevens">Haley Stevens</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="New Jersey02&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/New_Jersey%27s_2nd_congressional_district" title="New Jersey&#39;s 2nd congressional district">New Jersey&#160;2</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Jeff_Van_Drew" title="Jeff Van Drew">Jeff Van Drew</a>, who became a Republican on December 19, 2019.<sup id="cite_ref-46" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-46">&#91;40&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="New Jersey11&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/New_Jersey%27s_11th_congressional_district" title="New Jersey&#39;s 11th congressional district">New Jersey&#160;11</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Mikie_Sherrill" title="Mikie Sherrill">Mikie Sherrill</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="New Mexico02&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/New_Mexico%27s_2nd_congressional_district" title="New Mexico&#39;s 2nd congressional district">New Mexico&#160;2</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Xochitl_Torres_Small" title="Xochitl Torres Small">Xochitl Torres Small</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Pennsylvania05&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Pennsylvania%27s_5th_congressional_district" title="Pennsylvania&#39;s 5th congressional district">Pennsylvania&#160;5</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Mary_Gay_Scanlon" title="Mary Gay Scanlon">Mary Gay Scanlon</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Pennsylvania06&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Pennsylvania%27s_6th_congressional_district" title="Pennsylvania&#39;s 6th congressional district">Pennsylvania&#160;6</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Chrissy_Houlahan" title="Chrissy Houlahan">Chrissy Houlahan</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Pennsylvania07&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Pennsylvania%27s_7th_congressional_district" title="Pennsylvania&#39;s 7th congressional district">Pennsylvania&#160;7</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Susan_Wild" title="Susan Wild">Susan Wild</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="South Carolina01&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/South_Carolina%27s_1st_congressional_district" title="South Carolina&#39;s 1st congressional district">South Carolina&#160;1</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Joe_Cunningham_(American_politician)" title="Joe Cunningham (American politician)">Joe Cunningham</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Washington08&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Washington%27s_8th_congressional_district" title="Washington&#39;s 8th congressional district">Washington&#160;8</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Kim_Schrier" title="Kim Schrier">Kim Schrier</a>.</li></ol>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Open_seats_that_parties_held">Open seats that parties held</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=18" title="Edit section: Open seats that parties held">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Democratic_seats_held_by_Democrats">Democratic seats held by Democrats</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=19" title="Edit section: Democratic seats held by Democrats">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p>Democrats held nineteen of their open seats.
</p>
<ol><li><span data-sort-value="Arizona09&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Arizona%27s_9th_congressional_district" title="Arizona&#39;s 9th congressional district">Arizona&#160;9</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Greg_Stanton" title="Greg Stanton">Greg Stanton</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Colorado02&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Colorado%27s_2nd_congressional_district" title="Colorado&#39;s 2nd congressional district">Colorado&#160;2</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Joe_Neguse" title="Joe Neguse">Joe Neguse</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Connecticut05&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Connecticut%27s_5th_congressional_district" title="Connecticut&#39;s 5th congressional district">Connecticut&#160;5</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Jahana_Hayes" title="Jahana Hayes">Jahana Hayes</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Hawaii01&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Hawaii%27s_1st_congressional_district" title="Hawaii&#39;s 1st congressional district">Hawaii&#160;1</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Ed_Case" title="Ed Case">Ed Case</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Illinois04&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Illinois%27s_4th_congressional_district" title="Illinois&#39;s 4th congressional district">Illinois&#160;4</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Jes%C3%BAs_%22Chuy%22_Garc%C3%ADa" title="Jesús &quot;Chuy&quot; García">Chuy García</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Maryland06&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Maryland%27s_6th_congressional_district" title="Maryland&#39;s 6th congressional district">Maryland&#160;6</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/David_Trone" title="David Trone">David Trone</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Massachusetts03&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Massachusetts%27s_3rd_congressional_district" title="Massachusetts&#39;s 3rd congressional district">Massachusetts&#160;3</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Lori_Trahan" title="Lori Trahan">Lori Trahan</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Michigan09&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Michigan%27s_9th_congressional_district" title="Michigan&#39;s 9th congressional district">Michigan&#160;9</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Andy_Levin" title="Andy Levin">Andy Levin</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Michigan13&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Michigan%27s_13th_congressional_district" title="Michigan&#39;s 13th congressional district">Michigan&#160;13</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Rashida_Tlaib" title="Rashida Tlaib">Rashida Tlaib</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Minnesota05&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Minnesota%27s_5th_congressional_district" title="Minnesota&#39;s 5th congressional district">Minnesota&#160;5</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Ilhan_Omar" title="Ilhan Omar">Ilhan Omar</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Nevada03&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Nevada%27s_3rd_congressional_district" title="Nevada&#39;s 3rd congressional district">Nevada&#160;3</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Susie_Lee" title="Susie Lee">Susie Lee</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Nevada04&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Nevada%27s_4th_congressional_district" title="Nevada&#39;s 4th congressional district">Nevada&#160;4</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Steven_Horsford" title="Steven Horsford">Steven Horsford</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="New Hampshire01&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/New_Hampshire%27s_1st_congressional_district" title="New Hampshire&#39;s 1st congressional district">New Hampshire&#160;1</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Chris_Pappas_(politician)" title="Chris Pappas (politician)">Chris Pappas</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="New Mexico01&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/New_Mexico%27s_1st_congressional_district" title="New Mexico&#39;s 1st congressional district">New Mexico&#160;1</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Deb_Haaland" title="Deb Haaland">Deb Haaland</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="New York25&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/New_York%27s_25th_congressional_district" title="New York&#39;s 25th congressional district">New York&#160;25</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Joseph_Morelle" title="Joseph Morelle">Joe Morelle</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Pennsylvania02&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Pennsylvania%27s_2nd_congressional_district" title="Pennsylvania&#39;s 2nd congressional district">Pennsylvania&#160;2</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Bob_Brady" title="Bob Brady">Bob Brady</a> retired. Won By <a href="/wiki/Brendan_Boyle" title="Brendan Boyle">Brendan Boyle</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Pennsylvania04&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Pennsylvania%27s_4th_congressional_district" title="Pennsylvania&#39;s 4th congressional district">Pennsylvania&#160;4</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Brendan_Boyle" title="Brendan Boyle">Brendan Boyle</a> ran in <span data-sort-value="Pennsylvania02&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Pennsylvania%27s_2nd_congressional_district" title="Pennsylvania&#39;s 2nd congressional district">Pennsylvania&#160;2</a></span>. Won by <a href="/wiki/Madeleine_Dean" title="Madeleine Dean">Madeleine Dean</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Texas16&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Texas%27s_16th_congressional_district" title="Texas&#39;s 16th congressional district">Texas&#160;16</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Veronica_Escobar" title="Veronica Escobar">Veronica Escobar</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Texas29&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Texas%27s_29th_congressional_district" title="Texas&#39;s 29th congressional district">Texas&#160;29</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Sylvia_Garcia" title="Sylvia Garcia">Sylvia Garcia</a>.</li></ol>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Republican_seats_held_by_Republicans">Republican seats held by Republicans</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=20" title="Edit section: Republican seats held by Republicans">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p>Republicans held twenty-eight of their open seats.
</p>
<ol><li><span data-sort-value="Florida06&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Florida%27s_6th_congressional_district" title="Florida&#39;s 6th congressional district">Florida&#160;6</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Michael_Waltz" title="Michael Waltz">Michael Waltz</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Florida15&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Florida%27s_15th_congressional_district" title="Florida&#39;s 15th congressional district">Florida&#160;15</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Ross_Spano" title="Ross Spano">Ross Spano</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Florida17&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Florida%27s_17th_congressional_district" title="Florida&#39;s 17th congressional district">Florida&#160;17</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Greg_Steube" title="Greg Steube">Greg Steube</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Idaho01&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Idaho%27s_1st_congressional_district" title="Idaho&#39;s 1st congressional district">Idaho&#160;1</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Russ_Fulcher" title="Russ Fulcher">Russ Fulcher</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Indiana04&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Indiana%27s_4th_congressional_district" title="Indiana&#39;s 4th congressional district">Indiana&#160;4</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Jim_Baird_(American_politician)" class="mw-redirect" title="Jim Baird (American politician)">Jim Baird</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Indiana06&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Indiana%27s_6th_congressional_district" title="Indiana&#39;s 6th congressional district">Indiana&#160;6</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Greg_Pence" title="Greg Pence">Greg Pence</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Kansas02&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Kansas%27s_2nd_congressional_district" title="Kansas&#39;s 2nd congressional district">Kansas&#160;2</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Steve_Watkins_(politician)" class="mw-redirect" title="Steve Watkins (politician)">Steve Watkins</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Mississippi03&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Mississippi%27s_3rd_congressional_district" title="Mississippi&#39;s 3rd congressional district">Mississippi&#160;3</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Michael_Guest_(politician)" title="Michael Guest (politician)">Michael Guest</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="North DakotaAL&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/North_Dakota%27s_at-large_congressional_district" title="North Dakota&#39;s at-large congressional district">North Dakota&#160;at-large</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Kelly_Armstrong" title="Kelly Armstrong">Kelly Armstrong</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Ohio16&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Ohio%27s_16th_congressional_district" title="Ohio&#39;s 16th congressional district">Ohio&#160;16</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Anthony_Gonzalez" title="Anthony Gonzalez">Anthony Gonzalez</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Oklahoma01&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Oklahoma%27s_1st_congressional_district" title="Oklahoma&#39;s 1st congressional district">Oklahoma&#160;1</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Kevin_Hern" title="Kevin Hern">Kevin Hern</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Pennsylvania09&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Pennsylvania%27s_9th_congressional_district" title="Pennsylvania&#39;s 9th congressional district">Pennsylvania&#160;9</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Dan_Meuser" title="Dan Meuser">Dan Meuser</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Pennsylvania13&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Pennsylvania%27s_13th_congressional_district" title="Pennsylvania&#39;s 13th congressional district">Pennsylvania&#160;13</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/John_Joyce_(American_politician)" title="John Joyce (American politician)">John Joyce</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="South Carolina04&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/South_Carolina%27s_4th_congressional_district" title="South Carolina&#39;s 4th congressional district">South Carolina&#160;4</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/William_Timmons_(politician)" class="mw-redirect" title="William Timmons (politician)">William Timmons</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="South DakotaAL&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/South_Dakota%27s_at-large_congressional_district" title="South Dakota&#39;s at-large congressional district">South Dakota&#160;at-large</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Dusty_Johnson" title="Dusty Johnson">Dusty Johnson</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Tennessee02&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Tennessee%27s_2nd_congressional_district" title="Tennessee&#39;s 2nd congressional district">Tennessee&#160;2</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Tim_Burchett" title="Tim Burchett">Tim Burchett</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Tennessee06&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Tennessee%27s_6th_congressional_district" title="Tennessee&#39;s 6th congressional district">Tennessee&#160;6</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/John_Rose_(Tennessee_politician)" title="John Rose (Tennessee politician)">John Rose</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Tennessee07&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Tennessee%27s_7th_congressional_district" title="Tennessee&#39;s 7th congressional district">Tennessee&#160;7</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Mark_E._Green" title="Mark E. Green">Mark Green</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Texas02&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Texas%27s_2nd_congressional_district" title="Texas&#39;s 2nd congressional district">Texas&#160;2</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Dan_Crenshaw" title="Dan Crenshaw">Dan Crenshaw</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Texas03&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Texas%27s_3rd_congressional_district" title="Texas&#39;s 3rd congressional district">Texas&#160;3</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Van_Taylor" title="Van Taylor">Van Taylor</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Texas05&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Texas%27s_5th_congressional_district" title="Texas&#39;s 5th congressional district">Texas&#160;5</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Lance_Gooden" title="Lance Gooden">Lance Gooden</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Texas06&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Texas%27s_6th_congressional_district" title="Texas&#39;s 6th congressional district">Texas&#160;6</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Ron_Wright_(politician)" title="Ron Wright (politician)">Ron Wright</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Texas21&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Texas%27s_21st_congressional_district" title="Texas&#39;s 21st congressional district">Texas&#160;21</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Chip_Roy" title="Chip Roy">Chip Roy</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Virginia05&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Virginia%27s_5th_congressional_district" title="Virginia&#39;s 5th congressional district">Virginia&#160;5</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Denver_Riggleman" title="Denver Riggleman">Denver Riggleman</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Virginia06&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Virginia%27s_6th_congressional_district" title="Virginia&#39;s 6th congressional district">Virginia&#160;6</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Ben_Cline" title="Ben Cline">Ben Cline</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="West Virginia03&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/West_Virginia%27s_3rd_congressional_district" title="West Virginia&#39;s 3rd congressional district">West Virginia&#160;3</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Carol_Miller_(politician)" title="Carol Miller (politician)">Carol Miller</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Wisconsin01&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Wisconsin%27s_1st_congressional_district" title="Wisconsin&#39;s 1st congressional district">Wisconsin&#160;1</a></span>: Won by <a href="/wiki/Bryan_Steil" title="Bryan Steil">Bryan Steil</a>.</li></ol>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Resignations">Resignations</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=21" title="Edit section: Resignations">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>Three other members announced their retirements but then resigned early before their terms ended.
</p>
<ol><li><span data-sort-value="Texas27&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Texas%27s_27th_congressional_district" title="Texas&#39;s 27th congressional district">Texas&#160;27</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Blake_Farenthold" title="Blake Farenthold">Blake Farenthold</a> (R) announced his retirement December 14, 2017. He resigned April 6, 2018. His seat was filled by a special election for the remainder of the term.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Utah03&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Utah%27s_3rd_congressional_district" title="Utah&#39;s 3rd congressional district">Utah&#160;3</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Jason_Chaffetz" title="Jason Chaffetz">Jason Chaffetz</a> (R) announced his retirement April 19, 2017. He resigned June 30, 2017. His seat was filled by a special election for the remainder of the term.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="West Virginia03&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/West_Virginia%27s_3rd_congressional_district" title="West Virginia&#39;s 3rd congressional district">West Virginia&#160;3</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Evan_Jenkins_(politician)" title="Evan Jenkins (politician)">Evan Jenkins</a> (R) announced his retirement May 8, 2017 to <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_Senate_election_in_West_Virginia" title="2018 United States Senate election in West Virginia">run for U.S. Senator</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticList_24-41" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticList-24">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup> He lost the nomination and then resigned September 30, 2018, when appointed to the <a href="/wiki/Supreme_Court_of_Appeals_of_West_Virginia" title="Supreme Court of Appeals of West Virginia">Supreme Court of Appeals of West Virginia</a>. His seat not filled until the regular election for the next congress.</li></ol>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Close_races">Close races</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=22" title="Edit section: Close races">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>In eighty-nine races the margin of victory was under 10%.

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Election_ratings">Election ratings</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=23" title="Edit section: Election ratings">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_election_ratings" title="2018 United States House of Representatives election ratings">2018 United States House of Representatives election ratings</a></div>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Special_elections">Special elections</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=24" title="Edit section: Special elections">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_special_elections_to_the_United_States_House_of_Representatives" title="List of special elections to the United States House of Representatives">List of special elections to the United States House of Representatives</a></div>

</td>
<td nowrap=""><div class="plainlist">
<ul><li><img alt="Green tick" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/13px-Green_check.svg.png" decoding="async" width="13" height="13" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/20px-Green_check.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/26px-Green_check.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="600" /><span style="display:none">Y</span> <b><a href="/wiki/Susan_Wild" title="Susan Wild">Susan Wild</a></b> (Democratic) 48.5%<sup id="cite_ref-PAlist_56-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PAlist-56">&#91;48&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Marty_Nothstein" title="Marty Nothstein">Marty Nothstein</a> (Republican) 48.3%<sup id="cite_ref-PAlist_56-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PAlist-56">&#91;48&#93;</a></sup></li></ul>
</div>
</td></tr></tbody></table>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Alabama">Alabama</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=27" title="Edit section: Alabama">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_Alabama" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Alabama">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Alabama</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_Alabama" title="List of United States Representatives from Alabama">List of United States Representatives from Alabama</a></div>
<p>The state congressional delegation remained the same at 6–1 for Republicans.

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Alaska">Alaska</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=28" title="Edit section: Alaska">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_election_in_Alaska" title="2018 United States House of Representatives election in Alaska">2018 United States House of Representatives election in Alaska</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_Alaska" title="List of United States Representatives from Alaska">List of United States Representatives from Alaska</a></div>
<p>Republicans maintained control of the sole seat in the state.

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Arizona">Arizona</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=29" title="Edit section: Arizona">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_Arizona" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Arizona">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Arizona</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_Arizona" title="List of United States Representatives from Arizona">List of United States Representatives from Arizona</a></div>
<p>The state congressional delegation flipped from a 5–4 Republican majority to a 5–4 Democratic majority.
</p>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Arkansas">Arkansas</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=30" title="Edit section: Arkansas">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_Arkansas" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Arkansas">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Arkansas</a></div>

<p>The state congressional delegation remained the same with a 4–0 Republican majority.

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="California">California</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=31" title="Edit section: California">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_California" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in California">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in California</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_California" title="List of United States Representatives from California">List of United States Representatives from California</a></div>
<p>The Democratic majority increased from 39–14 to 46–7.
</p>
