<ul><li><img alt="Green tick" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/13px-Green_check.svg.png" decoding="async" width="13" height="13" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/20px-Green_check.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/26px-Green_check.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="600" /><span style="display:none">Y</span> <b><a href="/wiki/Doug_LaMalfa" title="Doug LaMalfa">Doug LaMalfa</a></b> (Republican) 54.9%<sup id="cite_ref-CAprimaryresults_71-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CAprimaryresults-71">&#91;60&#93;</a></sup></li>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Colorado">Colorado</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=32" title="Edit section: Colorado">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_Colorado" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Colorado">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Colorado</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_Colorado" title="List of United States Representatives from Colorado">List of United States Representatives from Colorado</a></div>
<p>The state congressional delegation flipped from a 4–3 Republican majority to a 4–3 Democratic majority.
</p>

<li>Mark Barrington (Republican) 35.4%<sup id="cite_ref-COprimary_74-13" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COprimary-74">&#91;63&#93;</a></sup></li></ul>
</div>
</td></tr></tbody></table>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Connecticut">Connecticut</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=33" title="Edit section: Connecticut">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_Connecticut" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Connecticut">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Connecticut</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_Connecticut" title="List of United States Representatives from Connecticut">List of United States Representatives from Connecticut</a></div>
<p>The state congressional delegation remained unchanged at 5–0 Democrats.
</p>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Georgia">Georgia</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=36" title="Edit section: Georgia">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_Georgia" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Georgia">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Georgia</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_Georgia" title="List of United States Representatives from Georgia">List of United States Representatives from Georgia</a></div>
<p>The Republican majority was reduced from 10–4 to 9–5.
</p>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Illinois">Illinois</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=39" title="Edit section: Illinois">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_Illinois" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Illinois">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Illinois</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_Illinois" title="List of United States Representatives from Illinois">List of United States Representatives from Illinois</a></div>
<p>The Democratic majority increased from 11–7 to 13–5.
</p>
<table class="wikitable sortable">


<tbody><tr>
<th colspan="2">District
</th>
<th colspan="3">Incumbent

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Indiana">Indiana</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=40" title="Edit section: Indiana">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_Indiana" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Indiana">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Indiana</a></div>

<p>The Republican majority remained at 7–2.

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Iowa">Iowa</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=41" title="Edit section: Iowa">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_Iowa" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Iowa">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Iowa</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_Iowa" title="List of United States Representatives from Iowa">List of United States Representatives from Iowa</a></div>
<p>Iowa's delegation flipped from a 3–1 Republican majority to a 3–1 Democratic majority.
</p>
<table class="wikitable sortable">


<tbody><tr>
<th colspan="2">District
</th>
<th colspan="3">Incumbent
</th>
<th rowspan="2">Results

<th rowspan="2" class="unsortable">Candidates
</th></tr>

<th>Location

<th><a href="/wiki/Cook_Partisan_Voting_Index" title="Cook Partisan Voting Index">2017<br />PVI</a>
</th>
<th>Representative
</th>
<th>Party
</th>
<th>First<br />elected
</th></tr>
<tr>
<th><span data-sort-value="Iowa01&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Iowa%27s_1st_congressional_district" title="Iowa&#39;s 1st congressional district">Iowa&#160;1</a></span>
</th>
<td style="background-color:#B0CEFF" data-sort-value="-1">D+1
</td>
<td><a href="/wiki/Rod_Blum" title="Rod Blum">Rod Blum</a>
</td>
<td style="background-color:#FFB6B6">Republican
</td>
<td><a href="/wiki/2014_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_Iowa" title="2014 United States House of Representatives elections in Iowa">2014</a>
</td>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Kansas">Kansas</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=42" title="Edit section: Kansas">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Louisiana">Louisiana</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=44" title="Edit section: Louisiana">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_Louisiana" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Louisiana">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Louisiana</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_Louisiana" title="List of United States Representatives from Louisiana">List of United States Representatives from Louisiana</a></div>
<p>All incumbents were re-elected and Republicans maintained their 5–1 majority.
</p>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Maine">Maine</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=45" title="Edit section: Maine">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_Maine" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Maine">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Maine</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_Maine" title="List of United States Representatives from Maine">List of United States Representatives from Maine</a></div>
<p>The 1–1 tie became a 2–0 Democratic hold.  This was the first use of <a href="/wiki/Instant-runoff_voting" title="Instant-runoff voting">ranked choice voting</a> to decide a House race.
</p>
<table class="wikitable sortable">


<tbody><tr>
<th colspan="2">District
</th>

</th>

</th></tr>

</th>
<th><a href="/wiki/Cook_Partisan_Voting_Index" title="Cook Partisan Voting Index">2017<br />PVI</a>

<td style="background-color:#B0CEFF" data-sort-value="-8">D+8

<td nowrap=""><div class="plainlist">

<li><a href="/wiki/Bruce_Poliquin" title="Bruce Poliquin">Bruce Poliquin</a> (Republican) (46.2% round 1, 49.5% round 2)<sup id="cite_ref-MEprimarylists_126-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-MEprimarylists-126">&#91;114&#93;</a></sup></li>

</div>
</td></tr></tbody></table>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Maryland">Maryland</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=46" title="Edit section: Maryland">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_Maryland" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Maryland">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Maryland</a></div>

<p>Democrats maintained their 7–1 majority.

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Massachusetts">Massachusetts</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=47" title="Edit section: Massachusetts">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Michigan">Michigan</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=48" title="Edit section: Michigan">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_Michigan" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Michigan">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Michigan</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_Michigan" title="List of United States Representatives from Michigan">List of United States Representatives from Michigan</a></div>
<p>The delegation flipped from a 9–5 Republican majority to a 7–7 split.
</p>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Minnesota">Minnesota</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=49" title="Edit section: Minnesota">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_Minnesota" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Minnesota">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Minnesota</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_Minnesota" title="List of United States Representatives from Minnesota">List of United States Representatives from Minnesota</a></div>
<p>Although half of the seats switched parties, Democrats maintained the same 5–3 majority.
</p>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Mississippi">Mississippi</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=50" title="Edit section: Mississippi">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Nevada">Nevada</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=54" title="Edit section: Nevada">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>

<td nowrap=""><div class="plainlist">

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="New_Hampshire">New Hampshire</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=55" title="Edit section: New Hampshire">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_New_Hampshire" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in New Hampshire">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in New Hampshire</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_New_Hampshire" title="List of United States Representatives from New Hampshire">List of United States Representatives from New Hampshire</a></div>
<p>The Democrats maintained control of both house seats.

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="New_Jersey">New Jersey</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=56" title="Edit section: New Jersey">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="New_Mexico">New Mexico</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=57" title="Edit section: New Mexico">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_New_Mexico" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in New Mexico">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in New Mexico</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_New_Mexico" title="List of United States Representatives from New Mexico">List of United States Representatives from New Mexico</a></div>
<p>The state congressional delegation changed from 2–1 for Democrats to all 3 seats being controlled by Democrats.
</p>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="New_York">New York</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=58" title="Edit section: New York">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_New_York" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in New York">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in New York</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_New_York" title="List of United States Representatives from New York">List of United States Representatives from New York</a></div>
<p>Democrats increased their seat majority in New York's congressional delegation from 18–9 to 21–6.
</p>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="North_Carolina">North Carolina</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=59" title="Edit section: North Carolina">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_North_Carolina" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in North Carolina">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in North Carolina</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_North_Carolina" title="List of United States Representatives from North Carolina">List of United States Representatives from North Carolina</a></div>
<p>Due to allegations of electoral fraud, the 116th Congress was sworn in with one seat vacant.<sup id="cite_ref-159" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-159">&#91;147&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-9th_160-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-9th-160">&#91;148&#93;</a></sup> On February 21, 2019, a new election was ordered by the state election board.<sup id="cite_ref-Re-run_161-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Re-run-161">&#91;149&#93;</a></sup>
</p>

<ul><li><img alt="Green tick" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/13px-Green_check.svg.png" decoding="async" width="13" height="13" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/20px-Green_check.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/26px-Green_check.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="600" /><span style="display:none">Y</span> <b><a href="/wiki/Ted_Budd" title="Ted Budd">Ted Budd</a></b> (Republican) 51.5%<sup id="cite_ref-NClists_162-27" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-NClists-162">&#91;150&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Kathy_Manning" title="Kathy Manning">Kathy Manning</a> (Democratic) 45.5%<sup id="cite_ref-NClists_162-28" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-NClists-162">&#91;150&#93;</a></sup></li>

</div>
</td></tr></tbody></table>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="North_Dakota">North Dakota</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=60" title="Edit section: North Dakota">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_election_in_North_Dakota" title="2018 United States House of Representatives election in North Dakota">2018 United States House of Representatives election in North Dakota</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_North_Dakota" title="List of United States Representatives from North Dakota">List of United States Representatives from North Dakota</a></div>
<p>Republicans maintained control of the sole house seat.

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Ohio">Ohio</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=61" title="Edit section: Ohio">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Oklahoma">Oklahoma</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=62" title="Edit section: Oklahoma">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_Oklahoma" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Oklahoma">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Oklahoma</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_Oklahoma" title="List of United States Representatives from Oklahoma">List of United States Representatives from Oklahoma</a></div>
<p>The state congressional delegation changed from 5–0 for Republicans to a 4–1 Republican majority.
</p>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Oregon">Oregon</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=63" title="Edit section: Oregon">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_Oregon" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Oregon">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Oregon</a></div>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Pennsylvania">Pennsylvania</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=64" title="Edit section: Pennsylvania">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_Pennsylvania" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Pennsylvania">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Pennsylvania</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_Pennsylvania" title="List of United States Representatives from Pennsylvania">List of United States Representatives from Pennsylvania</a></div><p>As a result of changes in the congressional map, the state congressional delegation changed from a 13–5 Republican majority to a 9–9 split.

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Rhode_Island">Rhode Island</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=65" title="Edit section: Rhode Island">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_Rhode_Island" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Rhode Island">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Rhode Island</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_Rhode_Island" title="List of United States Representatives from Rhode Island">List of United States Representatives from Rhode Island</a></div>
<p>The state congressional delegation remained unchanged at 2–0 for Democrats.
</p>

<tbody><tr>

</th>

<tr>
<th><span data-sort-value="Rhode Island01&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Rhode_Island%27s_1st_congressional_district" title="Rhode Island&#39;s 1st congressional district">Rhode Island&#160;1</a></span>
</th>
<td style="background-color:#B0CEFF" data-sort-value="-16">D+16
</td>
<td><a href="/wiki/David_Cicilline" title="David Cicilline">David Cicilline</a>
</td>
<td style="background-color:#B0CEFF">Democratic
</td>
<td><a href="/wiki/2010_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_Rhode_Island" title="2010 United States House of Representatives elections in Rhode Island">2010</a>
</td>
<td>Incumbent re-elected.
</td>
<td nowrap=""><div class="plainlist">
<ul><li><img alt="Green tick" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/13px-Green_check.svg.png" decoding="async" width="13" height="13" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/20px-Green_check.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/26px-Green_check.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="600" /><span style="display:none">Y</span> <b><a href="/wiki/David_Cicilline" title="David Cicilline">David Cicilline</a></b> (Democratic) 66.9%<sup id="cite_ref-RIsos_189-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-RIsos-189">&#91;176&#93;</a></sup></li>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="South_Carolina">South Carolina</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=66" title="Edit section: South Carolina">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_South_Carolina" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in South Carolina">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in South Carolina</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_South_Carolina" title="List of United States Representatives from South Carolina">List of United States Representatives from South Carolina</a></div>
<p>The state congressional delegation changed from 6–1 for Republicans to 5–2 for Republicans.
</p>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="South_Dakota">South Dakota</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=67" title="Edit section: South Dakota">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_election_in_South_Dakota" title="2018 United States House of Representatives election in South Dakota">2018 United States House of Representatives election in South Dakota</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_South_Dakota" title="List of United States Representatives from South Dakota">List of United States Representatives from South Dakota</a></div>
<p>Republicans retained control of the sole seat in the state.
</p>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Tennessee">Tennessee</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=68" title="Edit section: Tennessee">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_Tennessee" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Tennessee">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Tennessee</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_Tennessee" title="List of United States Representatives from Tennessee">List of United States Representatives from Tennessee</a></div>
<p>Republicans maintained their 7-2 seat majority.
</p>

<td style="background-color:#FFB6B6" data-sort-value="28">R+28
</td>
<td><a href="/wiki/Phil_Roe_(politician)" title="Phil Roe (politician)">Phil Roe</a>

</td>
<td nowrap=""><div class="plainlist">
<ul><li><img alt="Green tick" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/13px-Green_check.svg.png" decoding="async" width="13" height="13" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/20px-Green_check.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/26px-Green_check.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="600" /><span style="display:none">Y</span> <b><a href="/wiki/Phil_Roe_(politician)" title="Phil Roe (politician)">Phil Roe</a></b> (Republican) 77.1%<sup id="cite_ref-tnsos_193-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-tnsos-193">&#91;180&#93;</a></sup></li>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Texas">Texas</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=69" title="Edit section: Texas">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_Texas" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Texas">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Texas</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_Texas" title="List of United States Representatives from Texas">List of United States Representatives from Texas</a></div>
<p>The state congressional delegation changed from a 25–11 Republican majority to a 23–13 Republican majority.
</p>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Utah">Utah</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=70" title="Edit section: Utah">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_Utah" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Utah">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Utah</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_Utah" title="List of United States Representatives from Utah">List of United States Representatives from Utah</a></div>
<p>The state congressional delegation changed from 4–0 for Republicans to a 3–1 Republican majority.
</p>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Vermont">Vermont</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=71" title="Edit section: Vermont">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_election_in_Vermont" title="2018 United States House of Representatives election in Vermont">2018 United States House of Representatives election in Vermont</a></div>

<p>The Democrats maintained control of the sole seat in the state.

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Virginia">Virginia</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=72" title="Edit section: Virginia">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_Virginia" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Virginia">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Virginia</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_Virginia" title="List of United States Representatives from Virginia">List of United States Representatives from Virginia</a></div>
<p>The state congressional delegation flipped from a 7–4 Republican majority to a 7–4 Democratic majority.
</p>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Washington">Washington</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=73" title="Edit section: Washington">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_Washington" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Washington">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Washington</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_Washington" title="List of United States Representatives from Washington">List of United States Representatives from Washington</a></div>
<p>Democrats increased their seat majority from 6–4 to 7–3.
</p>

<tbody><tr>

<th><span data-sort-value="Washington01&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Washington%27s_1st_congressional_district" title="Washington&#39;s 1st congressional district">Washington&#160;1</a></span>

<td style="background-color:#B0CEFF" data-sort-value="-6">D+6
</td>
<td><a href="/wiki/Suzan_DelBene" title="Suzan DelBene">Suzan DelBene</a>
</td>
<td style="background-color:#B0CEFF">Democratic
</td>
<td><a href="/wiki/2012_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_Washington" title="2012 United States House of Representatives elections in Washington">2012</a>
</td>
<td>Incumbent re-elected.
</td>
<td nowrap=""><div class="plainlist">
<ul><li><img alt="Green tick" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/13px-Green_check.svg.png" decoding="async" width="13" height="13" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/20px-Green_check.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/26px-Green_check.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="600" /><span style="display:none">Y</span> <b><a href="/wiki/Suzan_DelBene" title="Suzan DelBene">Suzan DelBene</a></b> (Democratic) 59.3%<sup id="cite_ref-WAsos_214-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-WAsos-214">&#91;201&#93;</a></sup></li>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="West_Virginia">West Virginia</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=74" title="Edit section: West Virginia">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_West_Virginia" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in West Virginia">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in West Virginia</a></div>

<p>The state congressional delegation remained the same at 3–0 for Republicans.

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Wisconsin">Wisconsin</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=75" title="Edit section: Wisconsin">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_Wisconsin" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Wisconsin">2018 United States House of Representatives elections in Wisconsin</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_Wisconsin" title="List of United States Representatives from Wisconsin">List of United States Representatives from Wisconsin</a></div>
<p>Republicans maintained their 5-3 seat majority.
</p>

<tr>
<th><span data-sort-value="Wisconsin01&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Wisconsin%27s_1st_congressional_district" title="Wisconsin&#39;s 1st congressional district">Wisconsin&#160;1</a></span>
</th>
<td style="background-color:#FFB6B6" data-sort-value="5">R+5
</td>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Wyoming">Wyoming</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=76" title="Edit section: Wyoming">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>

<p>Republicans maintained control of the sole seat in the state.

<li>Natale "Lino" Stracuzzi (<a href="/wiki/D.C._Statehood_Green_Party" title="D.C. Statehood Green Party">D.C. Statehood Green</a>) 3.77%<sup id="cite_ref-DCprimary_223-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DCprimary-223">&#91;210&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li>Erik Metzroh (Independent) 2.41%<sup id="cite_ref-225" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-225">&#91;212&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li>Bruce Majors (Libertarian) 1.76%<sup id="cite_ref-DCprimary_223-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DCprimary-223">&#91;210&#93;</a></sup></li></ul>
</div>
</td></tr></tbody></table>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Guam">Guam</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=80" title="Edit section: Guam">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Northern_Mariana_Islands">Northern Mariana Islands</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=81" title="Edit section: Northern Mariana Islands">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_election_in_the_Northern_Mariana_Islands" title="2018 United States House of Representatives election in the Northern Mariana Islands">2018 United States House of Representatives election in the Northern Mariana Islands</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_Delegates_to_the_United_States_House_of_Representatives_from_the_Northern_Mariana_Islands" class="mw-redirect" title="List of Delegates to the United States House of Representatives from the Northern Mariana Islands">List of Delegates to the United States House of Representatives from the Northern Mariana Islands</a></div>
<p>The <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_election_in_the_Northern_Mariana_Islands" title="2018 United States House of Representatives election in the Northern Mariana Islands">election for a non-voting delegate</a> from the <a href="/wiki/Northern_Mariana_Islands" title="Northern Mariana Islands">Northern Mariana Islands</a> was postponed until Tuesday, November 13, 2018 due to the impact of <a href="/wiki/Typhoon_Yutu" title="Typhoon Yutu">Typhoon Yutu</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-hsa_228-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-hsa-228">&#91;215&#93;</a></sup>
</p>

</th></tr>

<td><a href="/wiki/Gregorio_Sablan" title="Gregorio Sablan">Gregorio Sablan</a>

<li><a href="/wiki/Angel_Demapan" title="Angel Demapan">Angel Demapan</a> (Republican) 36.23%<sup id="cite_ref-CNMI_231-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CNMI-231">&#91;218&#93;</a></sup></li></ul>
</div>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Puerto_Rico">Puerto Rico</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=82" title="Edit section: Puerto Rico">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/List_of_Resident_Commissioners_of_Puerto_Rico" class="mw-redirect" title="List of Resident Commissioners of Puerto Rico">List of Resident Commissioners of Puerto Rico</a></div>
<p>The <a href="/wiki/Resident_Commissioner_of_Puerto_Rico" title="Resident Commissioner of Puerto Rico">Resident Commissioner of Puerto Rico</a> is not up for re-election until 2020.<sup id="cite_ref-pasquines_221-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-pasquines-221">&#91;208&#93;</a></sup> Currently held by <a href="/wiki/Republican_Party_of_Puerto_Rico_(1903)" class="mw-redirect" title="Republican Party of Puerto Rico (1903)">Republican</a> <a href="/wiki/Jenniffer_Gonz%C3%A1lez" title="Jenniffer González">Jenniffer González</a>, who was first elected in 2016, the Resident Commissioner is the only member of the United States House of Representatives to serve a four-year term.<sup id="cite_ref-pasquines_221-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-pasquines-221">&#91;208&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="United_States_Virgin_Islands">United States Virgin Islands</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=83" title="Edit section: United States Virgin Islands">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_election_in_the_United_States_Virgin_Islands" title="2018 United States House of Representatives election in the United States Virgin Islands">2018 United States House of Representatives election in the United States Virgin Islands</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_Delegates_to_the_United_States_House_of_Representatives_from_the_United_States_Virgin_Islands" class="mw-redirect" title="List of Delegates to the United States House of Representatives from the United States Virgin Islands">List of Delegates to the United States House of Representatives from the United States Virgin Islands</a></div>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Notes">Notes</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=85" title="Edit section: Notes">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<div class="mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">In addition, five of the six <a href="/wiki/Delegate_(United_States_Congress)" class="mw-redirect" title="Delegate (United States Congress)">non-voting delegates</a> in the U.S. House of Representatives were elected.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-NC9-4"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-NC9_4-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-NC9_4-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-NC9_4-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-NC9_4-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"> Results from <span data-sort-value="North Carolina09&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/North_Carolina%27s_9th_congressional_district" title="North Carolina&#39;s 9th congressional district">North Carolina's 9th congressional district</a></span> <a href="/wiki/2018_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_North_Carolina" title="2018 United States House of Representatives elections in North Carolina">were voided</a>, leading to a <a href="/wiki/2019_North_Carolina%27s_9th_congressional_district_special_election" title="2019 North Carolina&#39;s 9th congressional district special election">September 2019 special election</a>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Dem41-5"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Dem41_5-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"> This figure represents the difference between the number of Democrats seated when the 116th Congress convened in January 2019 (235) and the number of Democrats seated when the 115th Congress convened in January 2017 (194).</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Rep42-6"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Rep42_6-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"> This figure represents the difference between the number of Republicans seated when the 116th Congress convened in January 2019 (199) and the number of Republicans seated when the 115th Congress convened in January 2017 (241).</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Vacancy-8"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Vacancy_8-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Vacancy_8-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"> The <a href="/wiki/116th_United_States_Congress" title="116th United States Congress">116th Congress</a> has one vacancy in the House of Representatives.<sup id="cite_ref-Clerk_23-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Clerk-23">&#91;17&#93;</a></sup> For further information, see <a href="/wiki/2018_North_Carolina%27s_9th_congressional_district_election#Refusal_of_certification" title="2018 North Carolina&#39;s 9th congressional district election">2018 North Carolina's 9th congressional district election#Refusal of certification</a>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-9"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-9">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Not including the <a href="/wiki/Resident_Commissioner_of_Puerto_Rico" title="Resident Commissioner of Puerto Rico">Resident Commissioner of Puerto Rico</a>, who serves a four-year term.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-47"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-47">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"> This seat was the tipping point seat for a Democratic majority.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-48"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-48">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"> The margin in <span data-sort-value="Illinois14&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Illinois%27s_14th_congressional_district" title="Illinois&#39;s 14th congressional district">Illinois's&#160;14th district</a></span> was just over 5.00%, but rounds here to 5.00%</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-No_run-off-63"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-No_run-off_63-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-No_run-off_63-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-No_run-off_63-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"> All races were decided on the initial primary date, eliminating the need for a runoff.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-64"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-64">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Louisiana will hold runoff election(s) on December 8, 2018, for any race in which no one candidate wins a majority of the vote in the November <a href="/wiki/Nonpartisan_blanket_primary" title="Nonpartisan blanket primary">jungle primary</a>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-68"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-68">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Galvin won the Democratic nomination as an "Undeclared" candidate. She would be listed on the ballot as "Undeclared" and the nominee of the Democratic Party.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Freeman-84"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Freeman_84-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">On September 24, 2018, the Democratic nominee in <span data-sort-value="Florida17&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Florida%27s_17th_congressional_district" title="Florida&#39;s 17th congressional district">Florida's 17th congressional district</a></span>, April Freeman, died. On October 1, 2018, Ellison was announced as her replacement on the ballot.<sup id="cite_ref-83" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-83">&#91;72&#93;</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-LibertarianAccess-181"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-LibertarianAccess_181-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-LibertarianAccess_181-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-LibertarianAccess_181-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">The <a href="/wiki/Libertarian_Party_(United_States)" title="Libertarian Party (United States)">Libertarian Party</a> does not have ballot access in Ohio or Tennessee. Therefore, Libertarian candidates Johnathan Miller (<span data-sort-value="Ohio15&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Ohio%27s_15th_congressional_district" title="Ohio&#39;s 15th congressional district">Ohio's&#160;15th district</a></span>), Greg Samples (<span data-sort-value="Tennessee02&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Tennessee%27s_2nd_congressional_district" title="Tennessee&#39;s 2nd congressional district">Tennessee's&#160;2nd district</a></span>), and David Ross (<span data-sort-value="Tennessee06&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Tennessee%27s_6th_congressional_district" title="Tennessee&#39;s 6th congressional district">Tennessee's&#160;6th district</a></span>) appear on their ballots as "Independents."<sup id="cite_ref-LPnoballot_180-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-LPnoballot-180">&#91;168&#93;</a></sup></span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>

<li id="cite_note-NClists-162"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-NClists_162-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-NClists_162-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a <ul><li><a href="/wiki/1788_and_1789_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections" title="1788 and 1789 United States House of Representatives elections">1788/89</a></li>
